page.title: 07ALL SORTS OF AMPNEY PRODUCE
page.content: Most of the land is used for grain or grass production. There is one dairy unit milking 239 cows. Another farm buys and fattens aroud 130 calves. One farm rears 30 pigs, three rear sheep and one is to start production of sheep's milk and cheeses. 127 deer are being raised at Park Farm for export to New Zealand and Australia. The 56 acres at the stud help support 22 cattle and 16 horses with grazing and hay. There are 5 acres of strawberries and raspberries for PYO off the A 417. A vineyard produces grapes which are made into wine which is for sale. Mr Norris's family have farmed Lower Field Farm since 1918 and he has never sprayed or used artificial fertilisers. He also grows prize-winning roses. His Christmas turkeys are delicious!
